channel.title: GSOC Blogs on Rajagopalan's Space
channel.description: Recent content in GSOC Blogs on Rajagopalan's Space

item.title: Coding week #1 - Experience GSoc
item.description: Hello everybody. This is me Rajagopalan working on getting webkit2 on haiku. Previously as you guys know we were trying to get IPC working. Well we have succeeded in that after hitting some obstacles. Message passing should not involve mainloop it should be totally dependent on the workqueue only. As the mainloop can be blocked because of JS Execution which leaves slow performance or even crash. Also we stumbled upon an IPC deadlock when we used mainloop (main application loop) as a proxy to send and receive messages.

item.title: Mid Community Bonding-- Gsoc
item.description: Introduction: Hello Everybody, I am G.Rajagopalan working on porting webkit2 to haiku as a part of my GSoC project. So here I am to share our experiences and work regarding the project üòÑ. Bonding Process: I have been with haiku for the past 6 (or 7 months I think) which went like a blink of an eye. I can definitely say that it is a memorable journey with Haiku. I owe it to the beautiful and friendly people who work for haiku.

item.title: Coding week no 2 and 3 - Gsoc
item.description: Report for Coding Week #2 and #3 Love that your beautiful face is reading my Blog today‚ù§Ô∏è. First all I woul like to ask sorry to my fans (if any üòÖüòÇ) for delaying the posts. Prepare to get blown awayüéâüéâüíª Ok let's all jump into the world of webkit shall we? History is awesome (just kidding üòâüòâ) Lets rewind a bit! Getting stuff to compile and build (painful but totally worth it) Oh ya not to mention :making friends!

item.title: Math facts
item.description: BAlert("Hello World","Introducing myself", "Awesome","Cool","Excited",B_SUMMER_IS_FUN); Introduction: I am RAJAGOPALAN GANGADHARAN doing Computer science Engineering in India and a GSOC 2019 participant with aim of porting Webkit2 to Haiku. First of all I would like to thank everybody for giving me this wonderful opportunity and I promise to not let the hopes down. I didn’t know much about BeOS until I saw Haiku. Well to be honest I fell in love with the GUI of haiku.
